meanings.definition: To become liquid or soft as a result of warming.
meanings.sent1: The ice thaws under the warm sun.
meanings.sent2: The frozen lake thaws in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The cold butter thaws quickly on the hot toast.
meanings.sent4: Her heart thaws with his warm smile.
meanings.sent5: The frozen ground thaws, revealing the green grass beneath.

meanings.definition: To become less reserved or formal in manner.
meanings.sent1: His stern expression thaws into a friendly smile.
meanings.sent2: As they talked, her shyness thaws away.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher thaws a bit when the students make her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room thaws as they share a joke.
meanings.sent5: The initial awkwardness thaws, and they start to relax around each other.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming liquid or soft as a result of warming.
meanings.sent1: The thaw of the frozen river began with the first rays of sunlight.
meanings.sent2: In early spring, you can see the thaw of the snow on the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The gradual thaw of the ice cream cone made it easier to eat.
meanings.sent4: The thaw of the chocolate bar in her pocket left a sticky mess.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thaw of the popsicle caught him by surprise.
